name: Characters in British TV sitcoms Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which British TV sitcom of the late 1970s/early 1980s featured the Parkinson family, Ben and Ria and their sons Adam and Russell?
questions.explanation:
Butterflies.

	'Butterflies' ran for 30 episodes over four series. Wendy Craig starred as Ria Parkinson with Geoffrey Palmer as her husband, Ben. Their younger son, Adam, was played by Nicholas Lyndhurst (later Rodney Trotter in 'Only Fools and Horses'), while Russell was played by Andrew Hall.The show was set and mostly filmed in Cheltenham in the English West Country.

questions.text: The siblings Dolly, Cissy and Charles Godfrey appeared in which classic 1960s/70s British TV sitcom?
options: Never Mind the Quality Feel the Width
questions.explanation:
Dad's Army.

	One of the all-time great comedy series, the 80 episodes in the nine series of 'Dad's Army' were first shown between 1968 and 1977. The doddering Private Godfrey, played by Arnold Ridley, who was already 72 when the first episode was filmed, played the platoon's medical orderly throughout the run. His sisters, who were frequently mentioned during the series, appeared occasionally, Cissy played by Nan Naughton and Dolly by Amy Dalby and, later, by Joan Cooper.

questions.text: The characters Linda and Tom Patterson, Tony Webster, David Harris-Jones and Jimmy Anderson were all regulars in which classic 1970s British TV sitcom?
questions.correct: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
questions.explanation:
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin.

	The 21 episodes of 'The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin' were first broadcast over three series between 1976 and 1979. Linda Patterson, played by Sally-Jane Spencer, was the daughter of Reggie and Elizabeth Perrin. Her husband, Tom, was played by Tim Preece and, in series 3, by Leslie Schofield. Jimmy Anderson, played by Geoffrey Palmer, was Elizabeth Perrin's brother.

questions.text: Which 1970s British TV sitcom featured the Johnson family, Charles and Florence and their daughter Shirley?
questions.explanation:
Citizen Smith.

	Written by John Sullivan, who later penned 'Only Fools and Horses', 'Citizen Smith' ran for 30 episodes over four series from 1977-1980. The hero, Wolfie Smith (played by Robert Lindsay) and his friend Ken live in a flat in the Johnson family home. Shirley Johnson, Wolfie's girlfriend, was played by Lindsay's real-life wife Cheryl Hall.

questions.text: In which post-1990 British TV sitcom were members of the Horton family, David, Alice and Hugo, major characters?
questions.explanation:
The Vicar of Dibley.

	Although its first run lasted from 1994 until 2007, there were only 20 full-length episodes in the three series of 'The Vicar of Dibley'. Dawn French starred in the title role of The Reverend Boadicea Geraldine Granger. Gary Waldhorn played Councilor David Horton, Chairman of the Parish Council. The cousins Hugo and the incredibly dumb Alice were played by James Fleet and Emma Chambers.

questions.text: Shirley Brahms, Ernest Grainger, Dick Lucas and Harry Harman were regular cast members in which 1970s/80s British TV sitcom?
questions.explanation:
Are You Being Served?.

	One of Britain's best-loved sitcoms, 'Are You Being Served?' ran for ten series with 69 total episodes from 1972-1985. Miss Brahms was played by the late Wendy Richard, who was one of only five cast members to appear in all 69 episodes before going on to star in 'Eastenders'.

questions.text: Which 1960s/70s British TV sitcom featured the Glover family, Patrick and his ex-wife Barbara, and their daughters Karen and Anna?
questions.explanation:
Father, Dear Father.

	There were 45 episodes in the seven series of 'Father, Dear Father' first broadcast between 1968 and 1973. Patrick Cargill starred as novelist Patrick Glover, with Ursulla Howells as his ex-wife. Other members of the Glover family who appeared periodically included Patrick's brother Philip (Donald Sinden) and his mother (played by Joyce Carey). The family's pet dog was named 'H.G. Wells'.

questions.text: Which 1970s British TV sitcom featured the Abbott family, Sid and Jean, daughter Sally and son Mike?
questions.explanation:
Bless This House.

	Set in the London suburb of Putney, 'Bless This House' starred 'Carry On' star Sidney James as hen-pecked Arsenal soccer fan Sid Abbott. The series ran for six series with 65 total episodes first shown between 1971 and 1976.

questions.text: Miss Tibbs, Miss Gatsby and Major Gowen were regular cast members in which 1970s British TV sitcom?
questions.explanation:
Fawlty Towers.

	Arguably the best all-time TV sitcom, there were only 12 total episodes of 'Fawlty Towers' split into two series first shown between 1975 and 1979. The Major (Major Gowen, played by Ballard Berkeley) and the two dotty spinsters Miss Tibbs (Gilly Flower) and Miss Gatsby (Renee Roberts) were the three regular guests in Basil Fawlty's seaside hotel. Set in Torquay, the show was co-written by John Cleese of 'Monty Python' fame and his then-wife Connie Booth, who played waitress Polly Sherman.

questions.text: Which 1970s British TV sitcom featured the Brandon family, Les and Annie, their son Carter, plus Carter's two uncles, Mort and Staveley?
questions.explanation:
I Didn't Know You Cared.

	Set in South Yorkshire, 'I Didn't Know You Cared' ran for four series, with 27 episodes shown between 1975 and 1979. The main character, Carter Brandon was played in the first two series by Stephen Rea, who would go on to earn an Oscar nomination for 'The Crying Game' and then by Keith Drinkel.
